algorithms.imageProcessing

Class CurvatureScaleSpaceCornerDetector

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.imageProcessing.AbstractCurvatureScaleSpaceMapper
      • algorithms.imageProcessing.CurvatureScaleSpaceCornerDetector

  • public class CurvatureScaleSpaceCornerDetector
extends AbstractCurvatureScaleSpaceMapper
    The code is implemented from interpreting several papers by the authors Farzin Mokhtarian and Alan Mackworth. They prescribe a method for detecting features and corners that is scale invariant, rotation and translation invariant and does not create artifacts as a side effect. The method finds edges in an image and then calculates the curvature of the edges to find "inflection" points along the curve. Those points of inflection as a function of scale parameter t are then findable in another image that may have rotation or translation, for example, using a search method such as A* to find the best matching features in t space. The process of creating the scale based curves is repeated for increasing sigma until no points are found with curvature = 0. The method uses the recursive and separable properties of Gaussians where possible.
    Author:
    nichole

        protected SIGMA getMaxSIGMAForECSS(int nPoints)
        maxSigma is defined by the ECSS algorithm in: 2006, "Performance evaluation of corner detectors using consistency and accuracy measures" by Farzin Mokhtarian and Farahnaz Mohanna in Computer Vision and Image Understanding, vol 102, pp 81-94.
        Parameters:
        nPoints -
        Returns:

      • findCornersInScaleSpaceMaps

        protected java.util.Map<PairIntArray,java.util.Map<SIGMA,ScaleSpaceCurve>> findCornersInScaleSpaceMaps()
        Find corners in the edges by creating scale space maps for each edge that range from a maximum value determined in getMaxSIGMAForECSS() and determine the corners in the highest sigma of those maps and refine the corner locations in the smaller sigma maps. The corners are found using the curvature minima and maxima points in the curve. A lower threshold is determined and used during the maxima finding and minima comparison. Each corner candidate is larger than one of the adjacent minima by a factor such as 2 or 3. The results are set in the instance variable corners. The returned variable is the set of scale space maps which might be useful for other purposes, but are no longer needed for the corner determination.
        Returns:
        scale space maps for each edge

      • findCornersInScaleSpaceMap

        protected PairFloatArray findCornersInScaleSpaceMap(ScaleSpaceCurve scaleSpace,
                                        int edgeNumber,
                                        boolean correctForJaggedLines,
                                        boolean isAClosedCurve)
        find the corners in the given scale space map. The corners are found using the curvature minima and maxima points in the curve. A lower threshold is determined and used during the maxima finding and minima comparison. Each corner candidate is larger than one of the adjacent minima by a factor such as 2 or 3. The returned variable is the set of (x,y) points for the candidate corners found.
        Parameters:
        scaleSpace - scale space map for an edge
        edgeNumber - the edgeNumber of the scaleSpace. it's passed for debugging purposes.
        correctForJaggedLines -
        isAClosedCurve -
        Returns:

      • removeFalseCorners

        protected PairIntArray removeFalseCorners(PairIntArray xyCurve,
                              java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> maxCandidateCornerIndexes,
                              boolean isAClosedCurve)
        remove false corners from maxCandidateCornerIndexes by determining if the corner is due to a jagged line. The flag "isAClosedCurve" is used to preserve corners that are on the edges of the curve because the calculation of curvature has used that property to do a more accurate "wrap around" calculation, so the corners there should be real.
        Parameters:
        xyCurve -
        maxCandidateCornerIndexes - indexes which are reduced by this method to a smaller number due to removing false corners
        isAClosedCurve -
        Returns:
        returns the found jagged lines in the edge
